result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert B. Bender

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.

1:48 PM Defendant Robert B. Bender in court.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg appeared via zoom for Robert B. Bender.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert appeared via zoom for State of Wisconsin. Atty Laufenberf has received copy of complaint, waives reading. Def. wants to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of time limits. STC for Nov. 7, 2022 at 11 a.m. State has complied with victim rights. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 032054,
Payable Number: 66998,
Receipt Number: 22R 003675,
Amount: $20.00

Maintain Absolute Sobriety 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license 
No domestic abuse or domestic violence 
No possession of dangerous weapons 
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105

4:02 PM Defendant Robert B. Bender appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own or court appointed Atty or represent self. Def. wishes to attain counsel. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State is in compliance with victim rights. State makes bond recommendations and requests a $3,000.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, No contact with victim or victims residence and no use or possession of dangerous weapons. Def. makes statement regarding bond. Court questions Def. employment and potential alternative residence. Father makes statement in court. Alleged victim makes statement in court regarding bond conditions. State makes remarks. Court considers factors and orders $1,750.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, no domestic abuse or domestic violence and no possession of dangerous weapons. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
